rev.comment: Rm per character images for depiction purposes per [[WP:NFLISTS]], and per [[WP:NFTABLE]] and in two cases violating [[WP:NFCC]] #10c

â
| Daniel "''Danny''" Fenton/Danny Phantom || "Mystery Meat" (episode #1) || [[File:Publicenemiesgoingghostdanny.jpg|right|150px]]
+
| Daniel "''Danny''" Fenton/Danny Phantom || "Mystery Meat" (episode #1) ||
{{Main|Danny Phantom (character)}} Danny Phantom ([[David Kaufman (actor)|David Kaufman]]) is the primary main character and protagonist of the series. Originally, he started off as a shy, average, clumsy, and occasionally superficial<ref name="Attack of the Killer Garage Sale">{{cite episode |title=Attack of the Killer Garage Sale. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Richard Bowman; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-04-17 |season=1 |number=4}}</ref><ref name="Beauty Marked">{{cite episode |title=Beauty Marked. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Kevin Petrilak; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-02-24 |season=2 |number=34}}</ref> 14-year-old boy who was desperate to fit in with his peers and be accepted. After a lab accident in his parents' ghost hunting lab, he became a half-ghost, and obtains a variety of ghostly abilities. A battle with a Lunch Lady Ghost placed the unsure Danny on the path to becoming a hero.<ref name="Mystery Meat"/> Despite his flaws, he is steadfast and loyal to his friends<ref name="Kindred Spirits">{{cite episode |title=Kindred Spirits. Director: Butch Hartman, Daniel De La Vega, Gary Conrad; Writer: Steve Marmel, Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2006-04-07 |season=2 |number=40}}</ref> and family,<ref name="Maternal Instinct">{{cite episode |title=Maternal Instinct. Director: Butch Hartman, Gary Conrad, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-02-18 |season=1 |number=16}}</ref><ref name="The Million Dollar Ghost">{{cite episode |title=The Million Dollar Ghost. Director: Butch Hartman, Ken Bruce, Gary Conrad; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-06-03 |season=1 |number=19}}</ref> He eventually grows, gaining great confidence<ref name="My Brother's Keeper">{{cite episode |title=My Brother's Keeper. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-06-24 |season=1 |number=9}}</ref> and maturity<ref name="Pirate Radio">{{cite episode |title=Pirate Radio. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Kevin Petrilak; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-07-22 |season=2 |number=23}}</ref> within himself, concentrating more on his heroic duties.
{{Main|Danny Phantom (character)}} Danny Phantom ([[David Kaufman (actor)|David Kaufman]]) is the primary main character and protagonist of the series. Originally, he started off as a shy, average, clumsy, and occasionally superficial<ref name="Attack of the Killer Garage Sale">{{cite episode |title=Attack of the Killer Garage Sale. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Richard Bowman; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-04-17 |season=1 |number=4}}</ref><ref name="Beauty Marked">{{cite episode |title=Beauty Marked. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Kevin Petrilak; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-02-24 |season=2 |number=34}}</ref> 14-year-old boy who was desperate to fit in with his peers and be accepted. After a lab accident in his parents' ghost hunting lab, he became a half-ghost, and obtains a variety of ghostly abilities. A battle with a Lunch Lady Ghost placed the unsure Danny on the path to becoming a hero.<ref name="Mystery Meat"/> Despite his flaws, he is steadfast and loyal to his friends<ref name="Kindred Spirits">{{cite episode |title=Kindred Spirits. Director: Butch Hartman, Daniel De La Vega, Gary Conrad; Writer: Steve Marmel, Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2006-04-07 |season=2 |number=40}}</ref> and family,<ref name="Maternal Instinct">{{cite episode |title=Maternal Instinct. Director: Butch Hartman, Gary Conrad, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-02-18 |season=1 |number=16}}</ref><ref name="The Million Dollar Ghost">{{cite episode |title=The Million Dollar Ghost. Director: Butch Hartman, Ken Bruce, Gary Conrad; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-06-03 |season=1 |number=19}}</ref> He eventually grows, gaining great confidence<ref name="My Brother's Keeper">{{cite episode |title=My Brother's Keeper. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-06-24 |season=1 |number=9}}</ref> and maturity<ref name="Pirate Radio">{{cite episode |title=Pirate Radio. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Kevin Petrilak; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-07-22 |season=2 |number=23}}</ref> within himself, concentrating more on his heroic duties.

| Vlad Masters/Plasmius || "Bitter Reunions" (episode #7) || [[File:SmugVlad.jpg|right|150px|Vlad Plasmius, the main antagonist of the series and arch enemy of Danny.]]
+
| Vlad Masters/Plasmius || "Bitter Reunions" (episode #7) ||
{{Main|Vlad Plasmius}}
{{Main|Vlad Plasmius}}
Vlad Masters ([[Martin Mull]]) is the arch-nemesis and worst enemy of Danny. A rich, debonair billionaire, Vlad is a powerful half ghost whose twenty years of experience constantly one-ups Danny's abilities. As the main antagonist in the series, he vows to destroy Jack for "stealing" Maddie whom he loves and for giving him his ghost powers.<ref name="Bitter Reunions"/> He also has goals to obtain Danny as his son and later, torment him after one too many rejections.<ref name="Kindred Spirits"/>
Vlad Masters ([[Martin Mull]]) is the arch-nemesis and worst enemy of Danny. A rich, debonair billionaire, Vlad is a powerful half ghost whose twenty years of experience constantly one-ups Danny's abilities. As the main antagonist in the series, he vows to destroy Jack for "stealing" Maddie whom he loves and for giving him his ghost powers.<ref name="Bitter Reunions"/> He also has goals to obtain Danny as his son and later, torment him after one too many rejections.<ref name="Kindred Spirits"/>
Line 54: Line 54:
<ref name="Fanning the Flame">{{cite episode |title=Fanning the Flame. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-10-08 |season=1 |number=11}}</ref>
<ref name="Fanning the Flame">{{cite episode |title=Fanning the Flame. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-10-08 |season=1 |number=11}}</ref>

| Nicolai Technus || "Attack of the Killer Garage Sale" (episode #4) || [[File:Technus.jpg|150px|right|Technus, the "Master of Technology (All Things Electronic & Beeping)", has the ability to control and merge together with technology.]]
+
| Nicolai Technus || "Attack of the Killer Garage Sale" (episode #4) ||
Nicolai Technus ([[Rob Paulsen]]), or commonly referred as just Technus, is the self-proclaimed ''"Master of Technology (and All Things Electronic and Beeping)"'' and has the ability to control and merge together with technology. Technus is a boisterous ghost who commonly shouts his name and goal as well as blabbermouth long speeches, a common flaw Danny exploits. He is also known for his use of out-dated slang, such as "hip", and "groovy". <ref name="Attack of the Killer Garage Sale">{{cite episode |title=Attack of the Killer Garage Sale. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Richard Bowman; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-04-17 |season=1 |number=04}}</ref> He later gains himself an upgrade, rendering himself as "Technus 2.0".<ref name="Identity Crisis"/>
Nicolai Technus ([[Rob Paulsen]]), or commonly referred as just Technus, is the self-proclaimed ''"Master of Technology (and All Things Electronic and Beeping)"'' and has the ability to control and merge together with technology. Technus is a boisterous ghost who commonly shouts his name and goal as well as blabbermouth long speeches, a common flaw Danny exploits. He is also known for his use of out-dated slang, such as "hip", and "groovy". <ref name="Attack of the Killer Garage Sale">{{cite episode |title=Attack of the Killer Garage Sale. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Richard Bowman; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-04-17 |season=1 |number=04}}</ref> He later gains himself an upgrade, rendering himself as "Technus 2.0".<ref name="Identity Crisis"/>
|-
|-

â
| Valerie Gray || "Shades of Gray" (episode #10) || [[File:Valerie.jpg|right|150px]] (Grey DeLisle and [[Cree Summer]]) is the series' main [[antiheroine]]. Once a rich, shallow, popular girl, Valerie's life takes a turn for the worse when a ghost dog cost her father his job. Now living an average life, Valerie vowed revenge against all ghosts for ruining her life after being given a ghost hunting suit and gears from Vlad (unbeknown to her at the time).<ref name="Shades of Gray">{{cite episode |title=Shades of Gray. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-09-24 |season=1 |number=10}}</ref> She is hot-tempered which often clouds her judgment, but slowly starts to realize a world beyond the superficial. She briefly strikes a romance with Danny Fenton.<ref name="Flirting With Disaster"/>
+
| Valerie Gray || "Shades of Gray" (episode #10) || (Grey DeLisle and [[Cree Summer]]) is the series' main [[antiheroine]]. Once a rich, shallow, popular girl, Valerie's life takes a turn for the worse when a ghost dog cost her father his job. Now living an average life, Valerie vowed revenge against all ghosts for ruining her life after being given a ghost hunting suit and gears from Vlad (unbeknown to her at the time).<ref name="Shades of Gray">{{cite episode |title=Shades of Gray. Director: Butch Hartman, Wincat Alcala, Juli Hashiguchi; Writer: Sib Ventress. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2004-09-24 |season=1 |number=10}}</ref> She is hot-tempered which often clouds her judgment, but slowly starts to realize a world beyond the superficial. She briefly strikes a romance with Danny Fenton.<ref name="Flirting With Disaster"/>
|-
|-
| Freakshow || "Control Freaks" (episode #20) || Freakshow ([[Jon Cryer]]) is the ringmaster of the Circus Gothica. An entertainer for the Gothic audience, Freakshow is eccentric, full of showmanship and creative. His family have used ghosts for their circus for years. Unsatisfied with just a showman's life, Freakshow used a magic scepter able to control ghosts and ordered them to steal goods. He went to Amity Park to make Danny Phantom a member of his performance. He succeeds briefly until Sam snaps him out of it.<ref name="Control Freaks">{{cite episode |title=Control Freaks. Director: Butch Hartman, Ken Bruce, Gary Conrad; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-06-17 |season=1 |number=20}}</ref>
| Freakshow || "Control Freaks" (episode #20) || Freakshow ([[Jon Cryer]]) is the ringmaster of the Circus Gothica. An entertainer for the Gothic audience, Freakshow is eccentric, full of showmanship and creative. His family have used ghosts for their circus for years. Unsatisfied with just a showman's life, Freakshow used a magic scepter able to control ghosts and ordered them to steal goods. He went to Amity Park to make Danny Phantom a member of his performance. He succeeds briefly until Sam snaps him out of it.<ref name="Control Freaks">{{cite episode |title=Control Freaks. Director: Butch Hartman, Ken Bruce, Gary Conrad; Writer: Marty Isenberg. |series=Danny Phantom |serieslink=Danny Phantom | network=[[Nickelodeon (TV channel)|Nickelodeon]] |airdate=2005-06-17 |season=1 |number=20}}</ref>
